articles.description: A man is held in connection with the death of Nottingham Panthers player Adam Johnson.
articles.title: Adam Johnson: Manslaughter arrest over ice hockey player's death

articles.description: Three non-league sides aim for EFL scalps in FA Cup first-round replays - follow text updates of eight ties and listen to BBC radio coverage.
articles.title: FA Cup: Horsham v Barnsley one of eight replays - text & radio

articles.description: Live coverage of the latest Premier League Match Officials Mic’d Up programme with PGMOL boss Howard Webb.
articles.title: Premier League Match Officials Mic’d Up live

articles.description: The Liverpool footballer cried as he hugged his father who was held by Colombian ELN rebels for 12 days.
articles.title: Footballer Luis Díaz reunited with father after kidnapping

articles.description: Jude Bellingham and Levi Colwill withdraw from the England squad for the Euro 2024 qualifiers against Malta and North Macedonia.
articles.title: Bellingham and Colwill latest England withdrawals

articles.description: Rory McIlroy is crowned Race to Dubai champion for a fifth time this week but his focus is as much on the future of the PGA Tour, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: 'Loose lips sink ships' - McIlroy coy on PGA Tour plans

articles.description: Former Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson and others pay tribute at club legend Sir Bobby Charlton's funeral.
articles.title: 'A wonderful, humble man' - Ferguson on Charlton

articles.description: There was more on the line than a spot at the 1990 World Cup - the United States team feared for their jobs, homes and the very future of football in their country.
articles.title: Bags of urine, cans of Bud and the team that saved US soccer

articles.description: Two-weight world champion Natasha Jonas will defend her IBF welterweight title against Mikaela Mayer in her hometown of Liverpool on 20 January.
articles.title: Jonas to defend welterweight title against Mayer

articles.description: A scathing independent report finds aspects of the Welsh Rugby Union were sexist, misogynistic, racist and homophobic, with elements of bullying.
articles.title: WRU 'truly sorry' after damning independent review
